definition: to ward off (a blow)/to withstand/to defend
surname Wei/vassal state during the Zhou Dynasty (1066-221 BC), located in present day Henan and Hebei Provinces
to guard/to protect/to defend/abbr. for 衛生|卫生, hygiene/health/abbr. for 衛生間|卫生间, toilet

(after a verb or adjective) one who (is) .../(after a noun) person involved in .../-er/-ist/(used after a number or 後|后[hou4] or 前[qian2] to refer to sth mentioned previously)/(used after a term, to mark a pause before defining the term)/(old) (used at the end of a command)/(old) this

sentences.english: Are journalists lovable rogues or human-rights crusaders?
sentences.chinese: 他們到底是可愛的流氓還是人權的捍衛者？

sentences.english: Now, I have long been a vigorous defender of free markets.
sentences.chinese: 現在，我一直是自由市場的有力捍衛者。

sentences.english: Those who deny individual rights cannot claim to be defenders of minorities.
sentences.chinese: 那些否認個人權利的人不能自稱是少數派的捍衛者。

sentences.english: Heavy artillery barrages will also help weaken the defenders.
sentences.chinese: 重炮海法也將有助於削弱捍衛者。

sentences.english: There was also no doubt in Terence's mind that Big A1 was Lisa's champion.
sentences.chinese: 特倫斯也毫不懷疑大個子艾爾是麗莎的捍衛者。

sentences.english: He says Kennedy was the defender of a dream.
sentences.chinese: 他說，肯尼迪是一個夢想的捍衛者。

sentences.english: There is underwater photographer Dos Winkel as a champion of the sea.
sentences.chinese: 一個是海洋的捍衛者水下攝影師道斯溫克爾。

definition: to regard it as an honor (idiom)
to obscure the facts (idiom); to mislead the public with prevarication and deliberate falsehoods
principle of people's livelihood, the third of Dr Sun Yat-sen's 孫中山|孙中山 Three Principles of the People 三民主義|三民主义 (at the time, meaning redistribution of wealth, self-sufficiency and internal trade)
